## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 203, 920, 255]]<|/det|>
In a restaurant, the tables are rectangular. Each table seats four people: two along each of the longer sides of the table (see diagram). Eight friends have booked two tables, \(X\) and \(Y\). Rajid, Sue and Tan are three of these friends.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 266, 146, 284]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 266, 920, 300]]<|/det|>
The eight friends will be divided into two groups of 4, one group for table \(X\) and one group for table \(Y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 312, 920, 346]]<|/det|>
Find the number of ways in which this can be done if Rajid and Sue must sit at the same table as each other and Tan must sit at the other table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 327, 920, 346]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 636, 920, 670]]<|/det|>
When the friends arrive at the restaurant, Rajid and Sue now decide to sit at table \(X\) on the same side as each other. Tan decides that he does not mind at which table he sits.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 682, 148, 700]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 682, 695, 701]]<|/det|>
Find the number of different seating arrangements for the 8 friends.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 682, 920, 700]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
